title: Walgreens, Target remove all 22-ounce bottles of J&J baby powder
text:
Walgreens and Target on Friday became the latest retailers to remove all 22-ounce bottles of Johnson & Johnson baby powder from their stores, after the healthcare conglomerate recalled some bottles because of possible asbestos contamination.

On October 18, Johnson & Johnson issued its first ever recall of baby powder inked to asbestos contamination.

The company faces thousands of lawsuits alleging that asbestos in its popular product gave people cancer, most notably, mesothelioma.

But never in its history had the company actually recalled batches of the product until this month.

J&J issued a recall of 33,000 of its 22-ounce bottles of baby powder after the Food and Drug Administration found asbestos in a sample of the talc-based product.

Walgreens and Target join CVS, Rite Aid and Walmart, all of which pulled the affected bottle size from their shelves earlier last week.

Walgreens and Target are the latest retailers to pull Johnson & Johnson's baby powder from their shelves and online stores after the FDA found traces of asbestos in a 22 oz bottle

'Following the national voluntary recall initiated by Johnson & Johnson, Target removed all Johnson & Johnson's Baby Powder 22-ounce bottles from our stores and Target.com,' the company said.

Kroger said on Friday its stores do not carry the product size affected by the voluntary recall.

On Thursday, Walmart Inc, Rite-Aid Corp and CVS Health Corp said they were removing the product from their stores.

US health regulators found trace amounts of asbestos in samples taken from a single bottle of baby powder purchased online.

Asbestos commonly co-occurs with talc minerals used to make baby powder.

Talc deposits are supposed to be tested for the presence of asbestos, which causes mesothelioma and has been linked ovarian and voice box cancers.

Until the recall, J&J had insisted that its products were asbestos free and safe.

In fact, the company's CEO, Alex Gorsky, testified as much under oath during a deposition for lawsuit brought against J&J over its baby powder just 13 days before the recall.

He may be asked to give a do the deposition over, and J&J has said the recall was made out of an abundance of caution.

All product returned to J&J through the recall process - whether the product is from the impacted lot or not - is removed from the marketplace permanently, J&J said on Friday.

The retailers that have issued recalls are still selling other sizes of bottles of J&J's powders as well as other brands of talc powder.
description: On Friday, Walgreens and Target joined Walmart, Rite Aid and CVS in pulling all 22 oz bottles of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder after a sample tested positive for asbestos, which causes cancers.
authors: Natalie Rahhal Deputy Health Editor For Dailymail.Com
